meanings.definition: To outdo in playing a game or sport.
meanings.sent1: She outplays her friend in chess every time they play.
meanings.sent2: The soccer team outplays their opponents with their strong defense.
meanings.sent3: The little brother outplays his older sister in a friendly game of tag.
meanings.sent4: His strategic thinking outplays all others on the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The young pianist outplays even the seasoned musicians with her talent.

meanings.definition: To surpass in skill or performance.
meanings.sent1: He outplays his classmates in math with his quick calculations.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast outplays her previous record with a flawless routine.
meanings.sent3: The chef outplays himself by creating a new signature dish.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to practice outplays any natural talent.
meanings.sent5: The artist outplays expectations with a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outwit in a competition.
meanings.sent1: The detective outplays the criminal by solving the case quickly.
meanings.sent2: The underdog team outplays the champions in a surprising victory.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outplays the hunter by leading him in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her wit and charm outplay her opponents in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The tricky puzzle outplays even the most experienced solvers.
